thread.title: Golden point is here to stay: Smith
thread.title_full: Golden point is here to stay: Smith

title: Golden point is here to stay: Smith
text:
NRL CEO Dave Smith rules out scrapping of golden point in grand finals Phil Rothfield Sports Editor-at-Large The Daily Telegraph NRL CEO Dave Smith rules out scrapping of golden point in grand finals Phil Rothfield Sports Editor-at-Large The Daily Telegraph The NRL draft merry-go-round 2:13 
NRL: The NRL hasn't quite grasped the draft concept like the AFL, as 2015 proved to be a season filled with big name players controversially signing to join other clubs. October 7th 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/NRL/ 
NRL boss Dave Smith has ruled out the scrapping of golden point extra time in grand finals. 
In an in-depth interview in tomorrow’s Daily Telegraph, Smith tells Sports Editor-at-Large Phil Rothfield he is against replays like in the AFL. 
Defeated Broncos coach Wayne Bennett criticised golden point after his team’s loss to the Cowboys on Sunday night. 
“I thought the spectacle and excitement at the end was first rate,” Smith said. 
“Both teams could have won as we all saw. A lot of people support golden point and so do a lot of the coaches. 
“If you were going to change it you’d have to push it through the competition committee and have it well discussed. Other Stories
